text: Floyd's is my go-to watering hole in the neighborhood.  It offers an extensive selection of beers, mixed drinks, and pub food in a typical Chicago pub environment.  The staff is superb, especially Rachel, who strives to ensure that your experience is enjoyable.
Me "Do you guys have a draft beer list?" Barkeep: "It's on the wall over there." Me: "I can't see it, I have terrible vision." BK: "Well maybe you should use your legs." Me: "Good idea." *Exits

Favorite bar in Chicago.  Neighborhood pub  with better than your normal bar food.  Good vibe.  Not too many "kids" like you find at the nearby Milwaukee/north/damen area. And family friendly within reasonable hours.  It's our 2nd home.

One of the best neighborhood/dive bars I've been to in a long time. It's an absolute go to staple for the Bucktown folks. The food is outstanding and always freshly prepared. Drink specials are right on and well priced. The bartender staff is just really friendly folks. Outdoor deck is something special and you can tell it was made by hand!

Very good happy hours, good location and a good beer selection. Food was ok bar food. It's the perfect place to go if you live in the neighborhood and don't feel like going anywhere else.. they had a small but nice outdoor area. Would've been great if it was a little bigger..

The boyfriend and I really love this place! Kind of kicking ourselves for not coming earlier as we moved into the area almost a year ago. The food is great! And priced just right! Everything we have tried has been delicious - fish and chips, burgers, pulled pork, chicken sandwiches, steak sandwich, wings, even the chips and salsa are amazing (hot and homemade). There service is friendly and on it. Definitely a chill local place. They also have a good beer menu with a cocktail list. This has become are new go to spot for dinner and drinks!  Cheers to Floyd's!

Neighborhood bar with a GREAT cocktail menu. I loved the cocktails because they were NOT SWEET. Very imaginative, and in interesting glassware. Drink specials, chill vibe, nice interior, clean bathrooms. Great bar, in my book!
Just stopped for drinks before a concert.   Didn't try the food but the bartender was as friendly as a bull dog

This is a cute neighborhood bar, decked out in Christmas lights and garlands even in late January.   There's a cocktail list on a chalkboard, a full bar, and beer.  The "Pilgrim's Punch," made with vodka, rye, ginger, cinnamon, and lemon is a five star homemade punch.  It's the type of drink that, when they're out, they're out - I saw it in a glass jug on top of the bar.  The Pimm's Cup is on point. Don't order wine here - it isn't a wine bar.  So don't complain that the Prosecco sucks because, duh, this isn't a wine bar. Servers are friendly, and bartenders know what they're doing. We hung out here for awhile, so we eventually ordered some food.  It's standard bar food here, but the mozzarella sticks and tots were enough to satisfy our appetites. The chairs at the high top tables are the BEST!  They are so comfortable!
Food is great....drinks are good and refreshing!  I could do with out all the flare the bald headed bartender wears on his old Benigans's vest!  He sucks! But trust me on the food n drinks!!

Dropped in to watch game 4 of the World Series as it was close to our Airbnb. Despite being busy the bartenders were on point. Excellent service the entire time. Good draft selection and specials. My cousin was impressed with their hummus plate...something he didn't expect on the menu at a bar. Really enjoyed the atmosphere too. Friendly folks, mostly Cubs fans during the game. Definitely recommend this place if you're in the Wicker Park/Bucktown area.

Have lived in the neighborhood for 20 years and have been going to Floyd's since it opened. We really enjoy this place. It is a great Chicago neighborhood bar with decent food. My overall review would be better if not for the poor service we have received from one particular server named Jessica. She generally lacks customer service and has a horrible attitude. Fortunately she does not work often, but Floyd's would be better served by employing nicer people.

The decorations are fine and the beer selection seems good, but after visiting a few times with friends I would suggest you go someplace else.  -The food just isn't great. I've had a burger and fries and something else that I've now forgotten - all just OK. It's nice that they have food, but there are better nars with food. -The service has been slow and, in one case, condescending and rude. One time, a bartender (shorter woman, dark hair) forgot one of our orders, failed to give us change for a 20 (she seemed to have confused me with someone else in the bar), and then was just mean about it when I raised the issue (I thought politely!) Enjoy the $14 tip. I don't intend to come back to Floyd's.

Another great burger bar in Chicago where you don't have to wait two hours for high quality food.  Prices are very reasonable for a half pound burger and the beer selection - draft and bottles - is diverse.  Old school jukebox with classic tunes and great atmosphere in general.

I've gone here a couple times and have left concerned about one of the bartenders.  She has darker hair and the first two times she was noticeably drinking behind the bar and clearly drunk.  Obviously bartenders are allowed to drink on the job, but usually they know how to hold their liquor.
Love this place!!! Great drinks, awesome service. Burgers and tots are amazing!! Highly recommend!

Wish I took some pictures of the mouthwatering burger I had from here! Quality beef on a pretzel bun with a variety of topping combinations. Choice of fries or tater tots as a side. Excellent beer list and great staff too. The bartenders are always friendly. Definitely a chill spot I would recommend to anyone just moving into the neighborhood!

Visited Floyd's Pub for the first time today and I can't wait to return.  Food was excellent with generous portions.  Drinks were also delicious and stiff.  The service was friendly and the atmosphere was laid-back.  Great city bar to unwind and enjoy the weekend.
Great music! Great place to have a few brews with friends.  Like the atmosphere.  Not sure how the food is.  Service is good.

I would give more stars as the food is quite substantial but the service... The female bartender and waitress are in their own little world. They pick and choose who to treat with respect and common decency. I've worked in the industry for many years so I can take a few hits but this is the third time I've been here and it's  consistent petty behavior. At first they seem nice but by the time you're ready to leave they do not give a S#@%! The only reason they got a tip was because I respect the job. They on the other hand; do NOT! #Pathetic #SameWaitressAllTheTime

Everyone at my table got a different burger and each one tasted exactly the same.  The fries were dry and crumbled apart in the over-garlicked aioli.  Ambiance was nice, though, and the open doors/windows were inviting on this beautiful recent weekend.

I wish I hadn't paid $16 for a burger that wasn't cooked the way I asked and was completely flavorless.  The chips and guacamole were fine, but nothing about my meal impressed me other than how highly it was supposed to be valued.
Best bar food I've ever eaten and one of the best bloody Mary's you'll ever taste. I look forward to going to Floyd's every time I'm in Chicago.

Floyds is an awesome neighborhood bar. They have a good selection of beers on tap and I'm always impressed with the food. I know it's probably not expected to order salads but they are actually really good quality. The hummus is great, burgers are awesome, plus they have tots. The garlic aioli they serve with the fries is really good so definitely get that on the side. Service is good and they have a great bus boy who always keeps my water full. If you're in the Bucktown area and looking for higher quality bar food at a good price, Floyds is the place.

Great neighborhood spot with great food.  At least as far as the double cheeseburger goes.  Really nailed the cooking and the burger held up perfectly from first bite to last bite.  I would definitely like to try some of their other options.

The beer and the staff are great, the server  puts up with my Friend who is an asshole by trade. Her name is Mary Beth/jessica She scares and intrigues me. It's a great mix, no joke. The food is incredible too  Did I mention jessica scares me? She's not making me write this. Really. No I'm serious as she's standing next to me. In all seriousness she is a sweetheart. She have us great advice on beer and food and we loved it and she is not standing next to me right now that I know of :D

We stumbled into Floyd's to kill time before dinner around the corner, grab some drinks and watch some Sunday Football. We really enjoyed the surprise. Really cool ambiance is both laid back and intriguing. Good list of craft cocktails on chalk boards behind the bar and our bartender, a Latina woman in a beanie, was very nice and attentive. Could tell it was a favorite in the neighborhood that I'm personally unfamiliar with. Next time I'm near Bucktown I will definitely be back.
Had their chicken sandwich - very thin - not much meat and it was dry. More bun than anything. Salad was okay.

Solid 3 stars. No one was overtly friendly but no one rude. Burger was fine, and satisfied my hunger. Beer was cold, so that's a good thing. I'd come back for a chill night to watch sports, drink, but not as a food destination. Probably a good spot for a night cap...

Horrible service. The bartender, small short haired blonde is flat out rude. And this isn't just a one time deal, several times she acts like she hates her job.  I don't review often and when I do it means "stay away". Yes this is a long standing neighborhood bar, and yes its successful, so why charge a $10 minimum bar tab on credit card? It's just money grabbing and cheap. Listen folks, floyds doesn't care about its customers, it only cares about money. And this patron with money will spend his elsewhere. Goodbye floyds. You won't be missed.

Floyd's is one of my favorite places in the neighborhood. The food is good, they have a ton of beer choices on draft that are changing all the time, and there's usually a pretty good daily special as well. On top of that, they always great us like old friends when we stop in.  The burgers are good and they serve their fries with a tasty garlic aioli -- throw in one of the several different Coop hot sauce options, and you've got a great thing going!

Love little neighborhood pubs but food here is abysmal and fried. Thought it would be safe to order guac and chips. Menu stated "Guac is homemade". Guac was bland and chips came fried and dripping with grease. Couldn't eat them. When I asked if I could just have some regular chips,  the bartender said "We don't have any" so for nine bucks I got a lump of bland guacamole.....was not offered discount or substitution. Epic fail.

Usually I have a great time in Floyd's. But the last time I was here the waitress kicked my friends and I out. She asked us to move to one table (there were seven of us taking up seven seats--a 5 top and a 2 top). But apparently since we were standing at times since we were playing darts we weren't allowed to take up the tables. They wanted us to move to one table. I explained that I am a frequent customer and have never had an issue. She took all our drinks and demanded we leave. We did. But I'm very disappointed that just because other people were looking for tables we weren't allowed a 5 top and a 2 top to accommodate our party.

I dropped in for dinner before getting ready to start the second half of my night. I had an order of spicy wings and an order of mozzarella sticks. The wings were, unfortunately, dry and chewy although the dipping sauce help this a bit. The mozzarella sticks were on par with the ones you get at Jack in Box for example. But hey, this is a bar that serves bar food, not a restaurant.  With regards to service it was good enough. The young lady that took my order did her part. Took my order, checked up on me a few times, brought me the bill when I asked. So that part was ok. Keep in mind it was not very busy at that moment (9:45 pm on Friday June 12th, 2015). Overall wouldn't my first choice for the "gastro pub" night experience.
Service really lacking,  seems like the severs don't really want you there.  Food ok, service gets horrendous when busy.
Great Place!  Usually go for Taco Tuesdays.  Yummy and the beer selection is varied and reasonably priced.

I just moved in across the street and was hoping this place would be my regular spot. Get your burger well done. I got major food poisoning from this place, and I was bed ridden for an entire day. Needless to say, I'll never be back.

Usually I come here at 5pm with my kids, eat and get the heck out before the bar crowd comes in. But last night I went at bar time and loved it. They have a real jukebox and it's packed with great records so for five bucks you can do some real damage. I pretty much played all of Beggar's Banquet which is always a good time. I was part of a pretty big group and even though our waitress hated us we still got good service. Then I had a cheeseburger. It was so good. Really really good. They really know their way around that dish. Someone else had a quesadilla and said it was great. I also know they have a killer soft pretzel. Good beer selection. Walking distance from home. Boom.
The nachos are the bomb - and the hummus is amazing! Fabulous beer selection and engaging staff. Love this neighborhood watering hole!

More like 3.5 stars, but will round up for my local neighborhood bar.....As a neighborhood bar, solid 4 stars. Nice beer selection, good service, chill/ casual spot to grab a drink or watch a game. We've tried the food twice so far & it has been average bar food (3 stars). Nothing to go out of your way to eat, but would would not hesitate to try more from the menu next time we are looking to grab a bite & a drink to watch a ball game.

Floyds is an amazing neighborhood with really good food.  I love going there for burgers, fish and chips, nachos, tacos on tuesday, and so many other things.  The fries are awesome and hand-cut....so good with the garlic dipping sauce!!!   Tony, the owner, is amazing.  He always remembered me, and made my day several times by bringing back an old menu item just for me when I requested.   The beer selection is great with a rotation three floods tap and also great lakes.   I recently moved from Chicago....and man I miss floyds.  I will be visiting it next time I am in chicago.

I live near Floyd's and have been here several times.  The food is always fantastic and the drink specials are spot on.  It's a place on the Wicker Park/Buck Town border that feels welcoming and neighborhood-y and a little more mature than what you would find in Six Corners or even down on Division.  It's a slightly older crowd, but still a group that likes to have a good time. The staff that I've encountered at Floyd's has been super friendly and kind.  I've never had an issue.  I've had "becoming a regular at a bar" as a life goal for several years now, and while I don't get out as much as I'd like, Floyd's is the place that I go to the most.  I recommend this place highly to everyone!

This is a great neighborhood bar. Their drink menu is fantastic. While I  didn't order food, the people around us did and it smelled fantastic. The wait staff was attentive and prompt. I will definitely keep Floyd's in mind when meeting up with friends. I hear their outdoor area is great during the summer.

I just moved to the neighborhood and was looking for a regular go-to spot. I've been here a total of two times.  The first time, the service was alright. The bartender did hang with her friends at the end of the bar for a lot of the time, but I get that it's a neighborhood bar, so I wasn't upset. She also seemed friendly enough. The second time I went was probably the worst experience I've ever had at a bar. The waitress was super rude and snooty to us. She scoffed at my friends beer request and then treated us like disabled children when we asked about the bill. Her and a coworker kept giving us dirty looks while talking to each other (Note: we were far from being drunk, loud, or rude. Her attitude was uncalled for).  We left as they were closing and hung out side on the sidewalk having some decent conversation and deciding what to do next. They closed up shop and left. The owner then gets in his tuck and pulls up to us, gets out of his tuck, and yells "I OWN THIS BAR! GET THE F*CK OFF MY PROPERTY!" We were on the side walk, which is public. We were not talking loudly, being mean, or even touching his building. He threatened to call the cops, and when we told him too, he drove off.  For the next 30 minutes, he drove around the block stalking us. He would drive a few blocks down and slow down to stare at us. We must have seen him pass us at least 10 times. It was super creepy and we felt a bit harassed at that point so we left.  I'd like to note that I live in the neighborhood and am officially scared to encounter this psychotic owner again. He was out of line, full of rage, and lost a lot of customers and regulars that I've discuss this story with.  TLDR: The owner of this bar is nuts and most of the wait staff think they are elitists. Don't support this local bar, go to a place where your business is appreciated.
Love this neighborhood bar! Tony and staff and always friendly and welcoming. Excellent food and great drinks - what more could you ask for?
Good crowd, good beer selection, decent food.  Great place to have around for a go to neighborhood bar.

I love this bar!!!  Great neighborhood spot with great food and awesome specials.  Kelsey and Jasmine are my favorite bartenders, the service is alwaya great.  I highly recommend this place to everyone.
Laid back Good beer selection Good music.  Easy  Service is decent but not amazing. Not sure I want to see the place with the lights up but with them down its a sweet bar and I wish unloved closer.

Great neighborhood bar on the corner of Oakley and Armitage.  They always have a drink special, usually an infused lemonade with vodka.  The also have a great beer selection.  I've had the burger, pear salad and chopped salad and all are good.  What makes this a 5 star place though is the service.  The bartenders and wait staff are always fast and knowledgeable about beer and drinks.  I've been a lot and never had a bad experience.

Bad service from overly tattoo freak girl made me give this boring bar one star. Nothing special here and only because it is in Bucktown is why it is crowded often and the menu looked expensive for a small bar

Great little neighborhood bar!  Not sure why people on Yelp have called it a "dive bar" cuz it isn't (trust me . . .I've been to plenty of those!) just a nice neighborhood bar with plenty of interesting patrons! Located on the corner of Armitage and Oakley, Floyd's Pub is the perfect place to grab a drink or dinner before heading down the street to the Gorilla Tango theater which is just what brought me to Floyd's the other night. While the inside has a nice sized bar to cozy up to, or plenty of tables is that's your thing- we chose to sit outside on this beautiful day and enjoy some of the great weather that make up a Chicago Summer! Rachel, our server, (and bartender extraordinaire as she seemed to be the only one working while we were here!) was quick to run outside and get our drink and food orders.  The drinks were good- well poured- and the food, while bar food like salads, nachos and burgers . . . . .the food was actually pretty good.  Yes, I sound surprised as I wasn't expecting that. The other thing is this place "aims to please".  We asked to turn up the volume on the TV so we could watch the Belmont Stakes and we were graciously accommodated . . .of course maybe that's because a horse race is over and done with pretty quickly! The drinks and food were well priced and if you drive you can probably find street parking easily.  The blue line Western stop is just a few steps away as well. All in all- an excellent neighborhood choice!
Good neighborhood dive bar. Dirty, loud, but most importantly the kitchen is open late. Burgers are good and portions are large. Nice beer selection and quite a few brown spirits to choose from.

The beer choices are awesome!!! The food is great!!! (The chicken strips were inhaled by the crew and all agreed were awesome!) Bartender was great, really on her game...(beer never got below a 1/4 glass before another was offered!!!)  We will be back for sure!!!   It's a great neighborhood bar...that you would travel outside your neighborhood to go too!!!
I only write positive reviews, and these guys get one. Solid service, strong drink menu, and a nice and friendly staff. Great Chicago neighborhood corner spot.

I come here as often as I can.  Maybe once every 10 days or so.  They do great food specials throughout the week which is great when I don't want to grocery shop.  The bartenders are incredibly friendly and are more than happy to keep your glass full. Speaking of, they have a large beer selection in both tap and bottles/cans and good deals on liquor too.   I suggest the wings or the meatloaf sandwich with one of their rotating taps.
Best steak sandwich, best wings (and grilled!) in the city.  The place is pretty divey, but it's perfect for a quick low-key lunch and the service is always great.

Fun, loud neighborhood bar. My girlfriend lives off the western stop and we pass by this place all the time. We finally decided to give it a try for dinner since I had some major bar food cravings and it delivered.  When we entered the bar we actually stood around for like 5 minutes waiting for someone to seat us. It took us a little while, but we realized that this isn't the place where you get seated, although what looked like the owner seemed to have passed by us multiple times to talk to other patrons without giving us a heads up. Our bad for not being regulars I guess. The bartender handed us a couple of menus and we decided on the popper burger with a side of fries and a grilled cheese with tots. Everything was definitely above average bar food- my burger was well cooked, thick, and juicy. A cream cheese topped burger was definitely not as flavorful as I hoped, but I think that was my bad for picking a burger that was, well, topped with cream cheese. Fries were pretty good though and came with this addictive garlic aoli. My girlfriend's grilled cheese was overflowing with cream cheese and I'm sure it all stuck to my arteries. Tots were a real nice touch, though nothing spectacular. Floyd's seems like a really nice neighborhood bar that has good vibes. They play really loud music and have all in all good food. My recommendation is that they tell people to seat themselves.

Meh. I'm sure Floyd's is great as a neighborhood bar, but for dinner... just meh.  My boyfriend and I got the grilled cheese with tots and a burger with regular fries.  To me... everything but the grilled cheese tasted frozen.  Just not that great.  I didn't see signs of a real kitchen though, so I guess it's our fault for eating dinner at a bar.  The grilled cheese was pretty delicious though, just be warned that they use three pieces of bread and use both cheddar cheese AND cream cheese. It was obviously delicious.  Service here was just okay too.  It's pretty relaxed, but I think that's also due to the fact that it's a teeny neighborhood spot.  I might be back to try out the nighttime vibe, but I wouldn't recommend coming solely for the food.

Floyd's is the best.  It is a perfectly non-partisan pub with excellent drafts, good specials, and really good food. Like, way-better-than-average pub food. Inside, it's cozy, with table seating in addition to the bar. The jukebox is loud, but solid. Waitstaff is wonderful. Hooray Floyd's!
Knowledgeable bartenders, great selection of whiskys and good food. Burgers outstanding.

I enjoy the burger special on Thursday night. They play the televisions too loud though. Solid beer selection on draft. Sometimes difficult to find ideal seating but it's a solid place within walking distance of my house.
Great spot. Swing by every Tuesday for the $2.50 beer special and $2 tacos. Decent atmosphere, fun wait staff, good beer list. I'll keep coming back.

One night my girlfriend and I decided to be adventurous and try a bar we've never been to before and came across Floyd's. The outside of the bar first caught my attention. It has a distinguishable sign and looks well maintained. Some bars in Chicago have a tendency to look a little alarming or the owners gave up trying to keep the outside of the bar "welcoming".  We stopped here and ended up having a blast. Good prices, good selection of beer. The staff was beyond pleasant. My friend and I had some very entertaining conversations with our bartender.  The inside of the bar was well decorated, plenty of tables to sit at, and good lighting.

2 reviews in one for this place.  Met my friend here last night for casual drinks and dinner. Part ONE = The food and drinks: They have a respectable variety of beers and a few house drinks that looked good but we didn't order any of them.  I ate a cup of chili (tasty) and chicken fingers (very good).  It took a while to get the food after we ordered (way too long for a cup of chili that was most definitely pre made and chicken fingers that just had to be fried) so... don't go here if you're in a hurry.  They have a bunch of burgers on the menu and i absolutely have buyers remorse, as when i later saw the burgers coming out of the kitchen I wished I had eaten one of those.  They looked DELICIOUS.   Part TWO = The bill:  My friend and I each got separate checks.  When he opened his check he said right away "I didn't order 5 Amstel's."  I told him he probably just forgot how many he had.  Then I opened my check and said the same thing. "I didn't have 6 Guinness?"  We are both convinced that they added extra beers to our tab.  We didn't bring it up because it was our word against theirs but if you go here be sure you keep track of how many drinks you have.  I'm 90% sure they added drinks to our tab. I would give the food 4 stars but the shady service gets zero stars and averages out as a 2 for me.  If I go back I'll be keeping an eye on my check.

Stopped in on Saturday night looking to have one beer before calling it a night. There was a good crowd that seemed to really be enjoying themselves in the front half of the bar. The back half was pretty quiet and had an open table so my dude and I sat back there. I had been dying for a good Belgian beer and they had just that on tap. We thought of heading down to the Map Room but it just looked too packed. This was a nice middle ground. My boyfriend has been there for food a few times and says it is good pub food, but I have yet to check it out. I will be back soon to try a burger and have another delirium tremens,

I had the tastiest cider here that's not available in Texas, so for that alone they get extra points! Also, it's a bar with food, so double extra points!  Galavanting through this neighborhood after a heavy brunch, we wanted to post up and catch a bit of the A&M/Bama game. Early on a Saturday afternoon, this place was practically empty, with plenty of room to belly up and settle in.  There are about 3-4 televisions scattered throughout, and they were willing to play different games for the few people that had preferences. They didn't scoff at the fact that my boyfriend was only drinking water and we were taking up space at the bar, which I appreciated. The bartender was nice and also offered some advice on places to go while we were in town.

Just moved to the neighborhood and thought I'd explore since I have always passed by and looked to be a good place to have a beer with a friend. It is a bit too loud to have conversation but the beer selection is decent. The drink/cocktail selection is very limited but the food makes up for it. It is good bar food EXCEPT for the service. Our waitress was very rude, careless and rushed us to order what we wanted to order. After our food and drinks were brought she only came back for the check at the end.
Food is Awesome!! Had the Pims cup, and it was glorious. Waitress was very nice and the place is cozy. Fantastic place!

Went in there last Saturday night, and got charged for three drinks I didn't order on my card.  I only ordered two drinks so it shouldn't have been hard to straighten out, but the bartender was a total bitch about it.  She refused to take them off my tab, despite the other server confirming I only ordered two drinks.  When I tried to reason with her, she said "you aren't going to tip me anyways" and walked away.  Well no shit. Too bad, I always like Floyds.  Good thing there are a million other bars in Chicago.

Love this place.  A solid tap beer list that is updated frequently and lots of other crafts in bottles.  Full bar with drink specials during the week.  The food is some of the best "bar" food I've ever had.  The chicken wings are phenomenal.  This place always seems to have a table available, too.

I've been coming to here for years and have always eaten and drank well. Cozy yet spacious bar with a back room. Nice patio. Food is solid. Down-to-earth customers and staff.  That's why I was a disappointed in the waitress who was working last night for dinner. I had talked up Floyd's to a friend who had just moved around the corner and our waitress was at best sullen and at worst rude. She was competent and we got everything we needed, but she was unfriendly and monosyllabic. No biggy, but not the kind of great service I usually get there.

Love Floyd's.  Sangria is my go to drink.  Everything on the menu is freshly made there. Give me hand cut fries, chips and guac, and a huge bowl of chili! Well and Tony is amazing! He runs a great joint!!

The tacos are on Tuesday night are just right.  Old fashioned hard shell tacos with fresh ingredients is a combination that is worth far more than the price they charge.  Couple the tacos with their quality beer list and you have a formidable meal for a decent price.  Bottom line = quality food and drink at value prices.

I went to Floyd's for lunch. I thought it was okay - not too bad for bar food I suppose. They have different daily specials, which is nice. Portions here are very generous. The salads were missing the bacon they were supposed to have. Service is friendly.

I've gone to Floyds many times. We have a soccer team that usually grabs some drinks and food after our games. We've never had a problem there. But last night there was a huge problem. I was really disappointed with Floyds last night. I was there with 3 other friends. We were having a good time talking, waiting to grab a drink from the bartender. The bartender was telling stories with other people, and albeit all by himself but taking his time with other customers. My friend was waiting for a long time for a beer. He signaled the bartender but he didnt serve him. My friend signaled him again and the bartender said "give me a second it's busy." My friend told him "you said that 5 minutes ago." Then the bartender completely lost it and lashed out. Yelling at my friend in front of the other customers, yelling obscenities such as "if you don't want to wait get the f*%k out of here.F&$#ing a$&h%#e." Now we all understand that it's busy, but its unacceptable to mistreat your customers in that way. You can count on no more visits to Floyds. There are too many good bars in Chicago to put up with that kind of service.

I stopped by here for this first time over the weekend and really enjoyed myself. I was having a long, frustrating day and decided, why go do work at a coffee shop when I can do work at a bar and get DRUNK at the same time? Seemed like a no-brainer to me... They have a solid wifi connection that made doing my work very easy. The waitstaff was friendly, and from the small portion of chips and guacamole I had, I'd say the food here seems pretty promising. The chips were friend to order, which bodes well for the attention they pay to the menu. But the icing on the cake was the drink special. This was on Saturday, and they were offering Four Roses Bourbon on the rocks for $5. It is a great price for a tall pour of a pretty good bourbon. I was a happy camper and spent about 3 hours enjoying the hawks game, the friendly customers, and getting my work done, all while getting progressively drunker.
The service is good and the beer is cheap. What else needs to be said? I do hear though that they have some damn tasty wings, so I will be back to try some when I get a hankering. Enjoy Suckas'!!!

I like this place because they have sports on TV which seems to be a rarity in my hood, play decent music (Beat on the brat by the ramones was on last time I was there), solid beer selection, and haven't had any food there that I have left on my plate. As long as you don't walk in with lofty expectations, you'll probably like the place.

"Friendly good time" are three great words to describe Floyd's Pub. The beer selection is great and the servers are friendly enough to remember your name/face if you come here often enough. Pros:  Great burgers Great beer selection (bottles and tap) Friendly wait staff Always a good food or drink deal  Cons: Small and can get crowded Can be expensive Overall I like Floyd's and frequent here once every month or so. I used to go here more often when I lived across the street.

Don't come here. I don't want you to take up a table when I'm wanting to enjoy great food, welcoming service, a fabulous line up of changing micro brews on tap (Brown Shuga', Gumball Head, etc), perfect volume of great music, inviting lighting. Stay away!!!!

I live not too far from floyd's and I dig this bar. Its got a decent beer list that they seem to switch out a fair amount and the food is stellar. The waitstaff is always friendly and the crowd isnt too douchy. Totally solid.

I really don't want to give this place even one star. A group of us came here the other night for a birthday party. One of the guys in the group was sitting near the door and people starting handing him IDs, thinking he was the bouncer. Even though I didn't know him all that well, we were laughing at the sight. We had been spending quite a bit on drinks from the bar and were having a good time, when all of a sudden the guy was kicked out of the bar. This was a shock but what came next was an even bigger shock. We had done nothing yet we were being yelled at to leave as well. I saw the apparent owner and said, "Can I ask you a question?" And do you know what he said??? He said, "F*** You!" Wow. What an unbelieveable way to treat customers that just spent a large amount of money at your bar. Obviously we won't be coming to this bar again, especially not with a ton of other cool places in the area.

Floyd's is a great neighborhood spot. Since moving to the neighborhood, i have already been there countless times thanks to their nightly specials on food and drinks all throughout the week. My personal favorite is Tuesday with their delish $2 tacos and $2.50 draughts. You can't beat it! The food is good, the staff is friendly, and the little bit of seating they have outside has a great view for people watching. I just wish they were able to have a little more outdoor seating.

Found ourselves in the neighborhood with some time to kill so the meal ticket and I stopped in.  As a cheap eating enthusiast I like that they put how many of a particular item you get for the price;for example: 6 mozzarella sticks $5. I also think their description of menu items areaccurate as opposed to trying to over sell their food. Overall the food was good, the service was prompt, but I wasn't too thrilled with their drink menu prices/selection.  I would go here again if I found myself in the area and take advantage of this off the path hang out.

I used to live across the street from Floyd's and surprisingly only came here 2 or 3 times for late night partying..... BUT i have gone here MANY times for happy hour and I absolutely love this place! The food is delicious - seriously probably some of the best cheese fries i've ever had, and very yummy grilled cheese here and their sliders are awesome too! really, I have never had anything here that I didn't like! and they have a large array of menu options to choose from as well. Their beer list is also quite large. I also really like coming here because it never seems to get too busy - well that's probably because i'm usually here early, but we never have a problem with getting a table. The parking around here is also easy to find for those of you who have to drive here. Last but not least, they play awesome music here! for 5 years now, but EVERY TIME I get a chance to meet a friend in Bucktown, i ALWAYS choose Floyd's to meet up at!

I like Floyd's. It's low key and reasonably priced. I had gin and tonic one time (heavy heavy gin) but my drink of choice is Original Sin. I like the chicken pesto sandwich with my drink. Friendly staff and old rock music.  A friend of mine is a regular here which is why we almost always seem to end up at Floyd's at some point. Little neighborhood-y place and very laid back.

floyd's is your run-of-the-mill bar.  nothing especially special about it.  neighborhood pub, not hipster or dive-y.  low-key.   the staff is friendly and nice.  not sure that i much more to say here.  there really isn't spectacular but if you live in the 'hood, it's a good, casual place to go.

What a magnificent place! I've been to a many bars in the Bucktown area, but this is a big step above the rest. Their beer selection is second to none. If you're into watered down generic beer look elsewhere! This place only serves top of the line beer on tap. Their Food is amazing. The meatloaf is award winning. It's as if they invented meatloafing.  Beyond the food and drink, the atmosphere is electric! I've spend many Tuesdays after work and into the wee hours of the night drinking to my hearts content. Never a dull moment here!  It would sicken me to not mention the waitresses. WOW is all I can say, most look like supermodels, I would do anything to be with one. I would like to use a line from my newest favorite movie Think Like A Man, "She got that Serena Williams JLO mashup booty!" HAHAH. I usually tip around 30-35% at most bars, but here my minimum is 40% or a flat rate of $25. In conclusion: If Flloyds was a women I would marry her, If Flloyds was a burger, I would eat it, if Flloyds was a deity I would worship it!

Now that I've moved out of the Bucktown hood, I think I'm going to miss this place, even though I was never a regular.  I guess there's not much that really makes this place "special" per se, but its a good  neighborhood spot.  Anytime I've ever ordered food, its been really good ($8 fish n chips on Fridays - yum) and the beer selection is above average.  They usually have something new/interesting on tap and the prices are fair.  Floyd's isn't very big and doesn't have a lot of seating so not a good place for a big group.  I'd say its a good place to catch dinner before a night our or stop in for a beer after work.
steak quesadillas are deeeeeelish! prices are super reasonable.  get there fairly early evening if you are with a few friends, as seating becomes scarce later in the evening

This is one of those bars that has down-to-earth bartenders, great beer selection, good vibe and it doesn't take itself too seriously. I can't wait for the summer to come so I can hang out outside in the patio. Just a good, solid bar.

Seriously, as I just clicked "Write A Review," my stomach growled. I love their burgers...and they come on a pretzel roll, which is awesome for this German girl. They have a great selection of drinks--beer, wine, alcohol. And the staff is always nice. I would say, though, sometimes they may not be the quickest in service. This place is truly laid back. In the Spring/Summer, they have a small patio with about 3 tables. It's nice to sit there, but the Armitage Ave traffic that gets stuck right outside sometimes is not the best sight.  I cannot say enough good things. Me gusta.

a neighborhood bar with a damn good beer list. I dig. The building that houses floyd's is actually protected because this is an old schlitz bar and one of the very few that are on the north side.  I came in here to watch some of the bears game while out on a crawl. I really liked the feel here and even though I was a stranger, it didn't feel that way. There was a nice crowd for the game and everyone was always welcoming.  Of course, my eyes darted straight to the board that had the beer list on it. While there were only like 6 or 7 drafts, there was no complaint about any of what they had on tap. What I got a nice kick out of was looking at the bottle list and them making you pay for miller lite, coors, etc. While they aren't the same price as the craft beers, they aren't cheap and they are trying to make you buy the craft beers. Good on them I say.  I was just here for the beer as I had already eaten. But, the grill smelled mighty good and I will have to sample their food on my next trip

Floyd's is a small neighborhood pub with a decent beer selection.  The service could have been better; our waitress was on her smart phone quite a bit and could have been more attentive for sure.  I got hungry and ordered the steak salad.  The steak was lean and tasty and freshly grilled to order.  And there was A LOT of it in my salad - definitely worth the ten bucks.

I went to this place on a Monday night, going to see a concert at the Congress. Stopped in because I wanted a beer, and found a really sweet bar with a solid beer selection and friendly service. The place was neigh empty, but still the bartender (a pleasant woman with blonde hair, can't remember the name) treated us well. Prior reviews of bad service may be due to several employees that were apparently let go because they were, well, "bad". At least, that's what a little bird told me.
Friendly bartender, decent selection of beer, great pumpkin soup, volume levels that allow a conversation, and $2.50 drafts on Tuesdays. What more can I ask for?

Really solid pub grub, a pleasant place to take in some sports. But definitely don't take your Mom here because the graffiti in the ladies room is mega-trashy. I guess they think it's funny because it's been up there for awhile?

Blah place, bad management = why waste your money here? Went here with a group of friends, sort of your typical neighborhood bar.  Few days later, looked at my bank statement and saw that I was charged three times rather than once.  I shrug and think, "Eh, I'll just tell them what happened."  Every place makes mistakes.  Multiple times, I've become a loyal customer to companies solely based on their stellar handling of a mistake. I go into the bar and ask nicely to speak to the manager.  The server turns to the manager/owner who is sitting at the bar next to us.  This guy is hammered.  In an easy-going way, I explain the situation and pull out my bank statement which shows the three debits.  The server says:  Yeah, I remember this.  'So and so' was processing it and said she messed it up."   Manager/owner(?) looks immensely bored and dismissively states/slurs that I need to call the credit card company.  I heard nothing like:   "I know it's going to be a pain for you to spend the 45 minutes on the phone managing this, and I realize that you already went out of your way to come over here to try to handle it.  We really appreciate our customers, so I'm very sorry for your inconvenience over our mistake."   Rather, I hear the equivalent to: "Sucks for you. Now let me get back to my beer." Fail. If you're going to have a run of the mill kind of place you should at least live up to the neighborhood dive expectation of good customer service.  Off the top of my head, I can name ten places that offer up same kind of atmosphere, food, and beer but don't treat their customers like inconsequential assholes.  I will be spending my money at those.

This is one of my favorite bars in Chicago.   I am sad I moved away from Bucktown and can no longer frequent Floyd's as often as I would like.  I used to come here every weekend.  The atmosphere is comfy, divey, yet nice... they have candles on the table and I have taken out of town friends here.  The service is great- Tony, the owner, is the nicest guy you'll ever meet.  This place doesn't do pretentious, so go find another spot if you're looking for a $13 martini.  The beer selection is plentiful, and the food is really good.  This is a great place to come chill out with friends, have a glass of wine, or watch a game.  I love Floyd's Pub.

I really wanted to like this place - but I really did not. The service was terrible. Our waitress was clearly more interested in her conversation with the girl at the end of the bar than serving our table, since she stood there chatting for 15 minutes while I waited for a beer.  When I asked for a recommendation for something similar to a Belgian Style Abbey Ale, the waitress recommended a wheat. Um, no. If you don't know what I'm looking for, please ask someone who does. Don't try to guess what I'm asking, then force me to drink something I'm not going to like. Or better yet, she could have offered me a sample of one of the beers she was recommending to see if I liked it first - yet, none of those things transpired. I ended up with a water. Ugh. The food was fine. Apparently, Floyd's no longer serves their Thuringer (essentially a meat-palooza on a pretzel bun), which I tried to order, and was told it was marked off on the menu and wasn't available. Well, if I could still READ it on the menu, then their efforts to mark it off need some work. Mmmmkay. So I ended up with the turkey burger. The pretzel bun was hard on the outside, soggy in the middle. The tater tots were nothing to write home about.  We paid and left. The end.

Perfect neighborhood pub! Has a great cozy atmosphere, affordable prices, and good service. Love the pork sandwiches, tacos, and California veggie sandwich. Definitely recommend for a casual night out!

This Place is awful.  The staff were a bunch of bags of dicks.  They called last call, let us buy drinks and then kicked us out a minute later.  Never in my life have I experienced that.  Seriously, don't even announce last call if you are going to that. I was truly disappointed with this place. Shame on you Floyds
When I lived in the area this was my staple. I miss it a ton. Everyone was great, the music is not loud, and the food specials are fantastic.

Met my husband here for a drink after a spa treatment across the street and loved the dive bar atmosphere. A little pricier than I would have anticipated, but it keeps the riff raff out of the bar from the area which is a plus. We were here during a Bulls playoff game and were able to get a seat at the bar with no problem. We ordered cheese sticks and they were amazing!!! Will definitely be back!

This is a fantastic neighborhood dive bar. Good specials, unpretentious, can always find an open table, and bartenders who will happily change the channel so you can watch a sports game, even if it isn't a local team. Floyd's takes a lot of pride in having high quality bar food, and it shows. I think their tater tots and chicken tenders are the only things that aren't fresh. However, since I'm a McDonald's fry junkie, I pass on their hand-cut fries in deference of their (once frozen but yet delicious) tater tots. I love this place and it's a great option for those in the viscinity, but I admit I might not go out of my way to go here if it weren't for the amazing BBQ meatloaf sandwich. It is truly craveable.....
Floyd's has the best bar food in the city.  You have to try their Steak Salad...food of the Summer!  Best hidden bar food in Chicago.

This place was cool because: They had tater tots They had Effen Cucumber Vodka HOOK LINE AND SINKER The bartender was nice and we got super delicious, large drinks. Try the ginger ale/Effen Cucumber. It's super delicious. It seemed like a nice, neighborhood bar and I would most definitely come back if I was around. I always feel weird reviewing bars, because a lot of times, a bar is just a bar. But this one was definitely above average.

I'm going to make it simple- I LOVE Floyd's Pub.  I would definitely recommend making this one of your regular hang-outs.  The staff is amazing- fast service and super friendly.  There is a huge selection of drinks to choose from and an amazing menu.  The food is exceptional and I have never been disappointed.  Floyd's is a place that I can always count on for a great time and a delicious meal, and know I won't be annoyed with the service.  The ambience is phenomenal as well.

I don't know how I missed this place until now but I'm 'sleep on it no more, Floyd's Pub is for serious.  I was there last night for a quick bite, had the BBQ Pork sammich, it comes on a pretzel hoagie and heaped with sweet caramelized onions. I could have used more sauce but I take my pull pork saucier than boy shorts and thigh highs so that could just be me. The flavor was on point, sweet and a bit smokey, it came nestled up next to a heaping pile of tots and I washed it down with a few Lagunitas IPAs. Delish. Speaking of, the beer selection is quite good. They run the gamut from $2 something or other (PBR, Schlitz and the like) to your fancy-pants Belgiany craft brews. For the hour or so I was there the music was excellent (Grandmaster Flash, Chaka Khan) and Jasmine behind the bar singing and dancing to herself is the icing on the cake.  Definitely worth checking out.

I don't remember this place.  I went with a few guys from my band after practice one night.  Must have had some extra drinks at practice that night and then a shot or two and some beers here.  4 stars because I was probably fschankered on the sauce and I don't remember hearing any stories about me being asked to leave.  Score.

In my neighborhood, this is my favorite bar.  First of all, I have never gotten a bad meal there.  Try the meatloaf (on special on Wednesdays); I guarantee it will not disappoint.  I never order meatloaf at a restaurant, but my friend introduced me to it, and it is one of the best I have every had.  I think everything on the menu is worth trying.  And I've tried a lot of their food. Drinks are decently priced. It's not the cheapest place around, but for the city it's decent. Service has always been good too.  I have nothing but great things to say about this place. If my friends and I are looking for a place to grab a drink or some food, it's always at the top of my list.

I've been coming here since I moved to Chicago and it's my standard neighborhood bar.  I really like the food, but it's definitely not the best place to watch a game.  A great chill bar to have a few beers and hang out - not a rowdy place by any means.

Went here on a Sunday night...It was pretty quiet which is great when you want to have a conversation with friends. The beer selection is good and the staff id friendly. I love that they have a jukebox, who doesn't love a jukebox? A great experience and will go back to try the food.

Good food.  The food specials hold up to the menu standards.  I recommend the Monday night fajitas, as well as the hot wings.  The HD screens have a variety of sports to choose from, and they are more than willing to cater what is playing to customer request.  They additionally have a decent selection of beers.

Floyd's is such a wonderful neighborhood establishment! They truly treasure the 'hood as demonstrated by their annual neighborhood appreciation party! My highlights: Chopped salad w/ Floyd's house dressing (tastes like a Burger King Whopper - in a good way!) + fantastic beer list (hello, modus) + friendly service. ME LIKEY.

I'm hesitant to write a review b/c I consider this my standard neighborhood bar and want to keep it that way.  It's not a "see and be seen" kind of a place but more of a "we just want to chill and hang out with the people we already know" kind of a place.  I love that I can always find a seat, there's a good beer selection and pretty good food.  This bar isn't fancy or gourmet but it doesn't have to be. The owner of the bar is just awesome.  He's always super friendly when he's behind the bar.  I've been the lucky recipient of a few comped shots and he's even gifted me a beer sign from the walls. My only complaint is that it's not the best bar for watching a game.  As someone mentioned, you pretty much have to sit at the bar.  But I can forgive as they've actually added a few tvs since I started going there.

This place is really nasty.  It looks like a party room at a run-down fraternity - dented/ scratched walls, filthy bathroom, stale smelling.  I ordered their special, Fish & Chips the other day.  Yuck - they fish looked & tasted like it had been fried in rancid grease for 30 minutes.  They should not be serving food.  The beer was tasty though.

Good food, great beer.  Enough said. The tacos are awesome.  They also use pretzel buns, which I have to agree with the other Yelpers is probably one of the most amazing concepts ever.  I don't know how one could use anything else, really. And the award goes to the cheese fries.  They are amazing!

Came here for a night cap on Saturday. Not crowded-plenty of seating. Typical bar food. Decent beer selection but nothing a well versed beer drinker has never seen before. Decent prices. Typically neighborhood bar - no reason to come from across town for a visit, but if ur walking by, stop in for a beer.

Could not possibly ask for better. First off, you gotta love the style of this place. Inviting and nostalgic. The specials here are ridiculously good. $4 Murphy's! I'm in for several. They have old school tall boys as well. I was very shocked by the fact that their food was not just tolerable, but actually some of the best I've had anywhere. The Nachos were absolutely awesome. I live in SoCal and have eaten my share of 'Mexican' food. This place takes the cake for best Nachos. Also great cheese sticks and giant pretzels. The staff was super friendly and nice with my large, rather intoxicated group. Even when we ordered food and no one remembered who ordered it, they were patient and understanding, instead of rude. Both the bartender and waitress, wished us a good evening and gave a genuine 'see you next time' wave when we all left. They've got a nice jukebox and darts towards the back near the bathroom, to keep you entertained. Try the Nachos and stay for the friendly, accommodating staff. Highly recommend a steaming hot bowl of Zima soup.

Very good bar food! The chicken nacho's were just fantastic. This neighborhood dive bar is now going on my must list everytime I visit Chicago. The service was great as our drinks never emptied. Bypass the map room and head to Floyd's Pub...You will be glad you did.

A friend of mine told me to check this place out a while back so I thought I would give it a go.  I was told I had to get a burger here so that is exactly what I did.  In my opinion it was very good, but nothing to go absolutely crazy for. I will say that they served it on a pretzel bun (which, let's be honest, are the best buns to serve a burger on.) They had some pretty decent specials throughout the week (I can't for the life of me remember what they were, but I remember thinking they were reasonable specials.) The bar itself is pretty chill, but very dark and kind of a weird atmosphere.  The beer list wasn't totally incredible either.  They had some decent bottled beers, but the draft beer selection was pretty lacking.  Overall, it is an ok place to visit like, if your friends are already there, but I probably wouldn't make plans to go here on my own.

They have pretty good Friday specials.  $8 for fish & chips and $5 vodka lemonades.  For a Friday night, it wasn't too busy.  It's nice that they have outdoor seating available as well.  They have a few tv screens if you want to catch a game but you'll have to sit at the bar to really enjoy watching the game.   The waitress was sweet.  She checked in on us from time to time.  She was very quiet when approaching the table though so my friends got startled a few times.  The fish & chips were good.  Someone else ordered a burger and to all of our surprise, they didn't offer American cheese.  He was disappointed but thought the burger was decent nonetheless.

Comfy little neighborhood bar that can only be truly appreciated by those it's convenient to.  I grew up in this neighborhood and am still around here quite often visiting my childhood home.  It's a friendly establishment that fits the bill when you just need a drink or are in the mood for some bar food (mmmm tator tots...).  I come here with friends alot who live in the neighborhood (surprise there).  It's like a cheers for us and the owner and staff are super nice.  They do not carry "typical" stuff here so if you're in the mood for a blue moon, you've come to wrong place.

Not bad not good. This is a pretty average place. Drinks are moderately priced and the food comes in good portions.  Its located in a nice area, and on nice days has a few outdoor seating. The flatscreens are small for a bar, but at least you can catch the game if you have to.   Beware!!! There is a Ninja waitress, that creeps up beside you like in Seinfeld, "The Sidler" One minute your chatting with your buddies, then you turn your head and she is there next to you standing silently and staring. She waits until you "startle yourself" and asks if you need anything. Kinda creepy but gets amusing after a while. Worst part is that her height makes it look like she is sitting  with your group, she is perfectly level with everyone sitting down. She is really nice though. You have been warned.

Floyd's food is ok, I had the burger with bleu cheese and bacon on it the pretzel bun was amazing but the burger was just so so, a little dry for my taste. There daily food specials seem like a steal but their regular prices are a little high for the medium quality.   The girl who served my friends and I flirted too much, this kind of thing is in bad taste.

floyd's is a great little neighborhood pub. for bar food, the food at floyd's is good. great selection of beer. and you can always get a seat. but, the music is just way to loud. i don't mean to sound like a grandma, but when i can't hear what the person next to me is saying and have a sore throat the next day from yelling, it's kind of a problem.

I live very close to Floyd's and I don't go there as often as I should. The bartenders are all really nice girls and Tony, the owner is a great guy. The food here is delicious - I really like the German melt on a pretzel roll, as well as the meatloaf. The beer selection is great too, but they did get rid of my beloved Guinness.

As always, I am attracted to good deals, and coming here on a Sunday provided them, with ample drink specials. The food, while not amazing, is decent, and I have to admit the chili was really good.  Nice service, easy to get to, and a good time.
Excellent service and yummy food, great beer specials too! Food was so good we went back the next night for more! Atmosphere was laid back and mellow.  A good-time neighborhood spot.

I am a big service guy...what can I say Service at this place is NOT good to say the least. Food is decent at best. Drink choices are plentiful but by the time you get a drink who cares?  With so many great places in the area skip this place!

There is a new owner/operator of this place (from what I can tell) and he's good stuff. What used to be a crappy neighborhood "I guess we can go there" is now a place to look forward to.  My faves: turkey burger -- served on La Briola pretzel bun (dear god in heaven!) or the pear salad, a healthy portion of some healthy goodies: spinach, pears, tomatoes, onions and then the kinda-not-really healthy stuff: goat cheese, candied walnuts and balsamic dressing. Yummers!  Pretty decent beer selection. It's pricey but I guess everything is these days.  My only complaint about Floyd's - their buffalo sauce! It sucks. It's like BBQ plus hot sauce plus more BBQ mixed together. I'd wish they'd get a better buffalo sauce. And I wish I'd remember to bring my hot sauce with me when I go there.

I agree with the previous post! Floyd's does rock! I've had the burgers and guacamole & chips! Everything was homemade and delicious! This place has been a great find! Definitely one of the top places for a burger!

Floyd's is another bar that I always saw on Armitage and was always curious about--driving by it looked mysterious, a bit dark, maybe cozy, I wasn't sure.  I finally went to check out a sports game during the week. I was a bit surprised to find that it was rectangular shaped, a thick long hallway almost, a big space.  I had imagined it as a cozier, squared out bar with not so much space.  They have a lot of old things for decoration--some vintage Elvis art on the walls (random), signs that read "Whiskey Row", a sort of make shift shelf with all the beers, old looking cabinets holding other liquor.  The bar is a thick, dark set of wood, nice and smooth, old and flat, long from door to about the middle of the room.  Behind towards the wall there are old, stool-sized tables (comfortable to sit for tall people).  The bar stools are pretty stable, but probably old.   It was on the empty side, with just one bartender working the whole place--whether you sat or were at the bar.  Groups of 2's, 3's and 4's came to have some food on the tables (some on the old side), and 3-4 people came to the bar (younger crowd), with gaps between the different customers. They had a pretty decent beer selection and a full bar, the bartender--a blond girl who had apparently just started--was really sweet, helpful, nice and made good drinks!  I was feeling really full so I didn't want beer, and went for Vodka Water (Ketel Vodka).  She made a Perfect mix of it--it had a good amount of Vodka (which is excellent!!) and just enough water to make it pleasant.  I ordered two!  My friend got a Unibroue, and then a Sangria that was on special (which was okay).  We seriously contemplated some dishes, as you can see the cook to the right of the bar fire up the grill.  You will soon smell everything everyone else is going to eat.   The feeling is very rustic, almost like an old western bar, good for stiff drinks, excellent for conversation (music was nice and comfortably low, but not completely nonexistent) and a good place for a low key time with friends.  The customers at the bar also seemed friendly, but mostly stuck to themselves. Oh and the bartender didn't know that the NBA playoffs were on, and they had 3 TV's showing regular season baseball games (not a bad choice), but I had to enlighten her about the Conference Finals in the NBA, and she gladly switched it right when the basketball game started (come to think of it, I shoud've tipped her more, because after this, I went to Cleo's and had a horrible Vodka Water (I reviewed it) and was wishing that this bartender gave the Cleo's bartender some SCHOOLIN). By the time we left, the place was empty, which made me sad.  I will support them more often (it was a Monday though--Cleo's 25 cent wing special steals the food market). I will definitely return to this place.  Because it's a low key place with not much emphasis on the appearance, I'm giving it a 3. But: Drinks - 5 Service - 5 Satisfaction - 5 Food - ?  I'll return.

Love the burger on the pretzel roll, the nicely rounded beer selection, and the outdoor seating.  Hate the super LOUD shitty electronic jukebox churning out shitty songs.  It's a solid pub choice.  Best in the early afternoon, get the tater tots, and the bloody mary's are very good.

3.5 stars This is a cute little neighborhood bar with good food and a decent beer menu. I discovered Floyd's when it became the destination for a meal and drink before a show at Gorilla Tango Theater due to its proximity. Over the years, my friends and I have returned made it routine to hit Floyd's before a trip to Gorilla Tango. Floyd's food menu, decent beer menu, reasonable prices, and laid back vibe keep me coming back. It had been some time since my last visit and I was a bit disappointed to see the menu had changed; in particular I missed this really yummy seared tuna sandwich I used to order. I also noticed that the Cuban my friend used to order seems to have vanished too. This visit I went with the tuna melt and subbed a cup of roasted tomato soup as my side. My meal was fine, but really nothing special. I felt like the tuna melt was a bit skimpy, it was definitely lacking in the tuna salad area. The soup was also average and erred on the bland side. I wasn't unhappy with my meal, I just found it a letdown compared to some prior dining experiences. The place is small and fills up fast, although never seems uncomfortably crowded. There are a handful of tables and bar seating. They add a few outdoor tables when the weather's nice. If you're looking for a place to grab a drink and have a meaningful chat, I wouldn't recommend Foyd's; it gets really loud, mostly due to the volume of the music. Would I come back to Floyd's? Definitely, even if I wasn't headed to a performance down the street. Would I go out of my way to make it a destination? Probably not.

Just moved to Chicago and this will probably be my "go to" bar.  It's exactly what you would expect out of your favorite neighborhood bar.  Friendly bartenders, darts, good beer selection, average prices, food is OK, but the nachos... the nachos are phenomenal.

Floyd's food rocks.  It's high quality pub food.  My favorites are the meatloaf/onion ring/bbq sauce sandwich on a pretzel bun and the triple decker grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup.  (Don't be fooled though.  They call it a triple decker sandwich, but it's only a double decker.  Hopefully you'll get over the misleading name when you taste how delicious it is.)  I'm also a big fan of any place with tater tots. They have a nice beer selection.  It's no Map Room, but its better than most pubs.  Plus, Map Room doesn't serve food.  If you want to go to the Map Room, but you need to eat, Floyd's is your place.

It's my neighborhood bar, i have to love it. They serve me food when i don't feel like cooking, the tap is kept interesting and there is always a special. Its the type of bar where i can set up my computer, eat my meal, enjoy my beer and not be bothered.  If i feel like talking to someone there are always friendly peeps chillin out.  they host a free street party in the summer with good beer and good food and again, i said free. I can always count on floyds.

Floyds Pub is our local neighborhood bar. The owner is great and goes out of his way for his customers. The place is chill and perfect if you want to grab a casual beer or stay close to home. I wouldn't say the food is superb but good. Worth checking out on a laid back Friday night.

We used to frequent this bar last year when my friends lived in the area. It's a better alternative when the Map Room is crazy busy (like...always) and the service has always been stellar. The big pretzels are tasty and they used to have a sausage night, not sure if they still do. I've always had decent specials and had good bar service - even when we were way in the back playing darts.

They have a small but respectable selection of beer to choose from. I tried a few new ones...all delicious.   I've come here a few times and it's never too packed that you can't find a place to sit down. The music sometimes gets really loud, usually around the time they are closing. Maybe that's their clever way of annoying you to death so that you leave by 2. If you're still sitting there by 2, a guy will walk up and down the bar tapping you on the back every 5 seconds, saying "TIME TA GO!" Pretty standard behavior for a bar, but for some reason, this guy was just really obnoxious.  Sit up at the bar for prime entertainment. Everyone who works here is out of their minds.

Been goin there since they opened. Every year the owner throws a block party, usually end of August, providing free food/drinks and a couple of local bands. The service and food are great. The place has an "old chicago bar" feel to it, which I love. The owner is usually there so if a problem arises he will take care of it. If you get a chance swing by and see for yourself. The crowd is mixed, young/artsy/older so whatever you are you'll fit in just fine. Keep up the great work guys!

Had to go in here for a change of scenery from the Cleo's/Map Room stronghold.  The drinks were strong but not vomit-like, and the moderate amount of beers they have something for everyone.   The interior is what you would expect from the bar name itself, and the staff was nice and not pushy.   That's all I got.

Lots of average reviews for a pretty average place. The food can be decent, but it can also be bland. Definitely hit or miss. I've had the pasta, grilled cheese, and a sandwich or two, all just okay. We always get the guacamole which is huge and good for sharing, but again not the freshest. The drinks are nothing special, but they are cheap for the area. Service is quick and the staff are friendly which gives them an extra star. If you live close by and want a quick bite to eat or just a drink or two, Floyd's is convenient and you won't have to spend much money. If you have time and want better food, head closer to Damen. There are plenty more options there.

Went here after meeting the owner's relatives. Said they had amazing wings... I always challenge and conquer amazing wings. Wings were ok. Meaty, hot, crisp, but not buffalo... more of a spicy bbq sauce. Disappointed. The boyfriend ordered a *cider, which was flat and he barely drank half of it. *Guinness was excellent... when isn't it? Dinner was AWFUL. Over-fried, hard, greasy fish and HAIR in my fries.... this place was pretty empty for a Saturday and now I know exactly why. Boyfriend ate most of his burger and said it was huge, but not very good... and he thinks adding ketchup to anything makes it good. Anyone who visits Floyd's twice must live in crawling distance and comes for the beer first (contrary to the menu's slogan).

I live just down the block from this place.  It's nothing special.   Definitely not my neighborhood hangout for a couple reasons: 1. Food is terrible.  The goofs on here who say they like the food must have been raised by goats & eaten garbage growing up.  It's tough to screw up bar food, but Floyd's manages to do it with ease. Burgers are dry, even ordered medium rare.  I think they just ask "how do you want it" as a mere formality.   The three times I've eaten here (never again mind you) the fries were brown and stale.  They're too lazy to cook new ones every hour so they just serve you what's been sitting in the fryer all day.   2.  Which brings me to the staff.  You work in a freaking bar.  Spare us the attitude...  seriously.  I know you're only doing this cause your parents cut you off, and/or you flunked out of college, but come on!  it's not that difficult to serve people beer within a couple moments when the bar is empty. That's maybe the only good thing about Floyd's... it doesn't get too crowded.

This is the *current* name of this venue. (I have communicated with Yelp that its predecessor has closed.)  It was atypical of me that I stopped here, instead of finally getting to the Charleston one block north of the Map Room. (I did go on to the Map Room.)  But I visited here on a Wednesday night because I learned that _Tiffany_, who was the Saturday evening bartender at the _Twisted Spoke Tavern_ for six of the years that I presented the smut portion of "Smut & Eggs", had wound up here, and was working this night. The Spoke's new bar manager shifted her off of Saturday, for specious reasons. She quit a month later. Floyd's Pub is a refinement of the sports bar, adapted for the quieter neighborhood that is Bucktown. There are three large flat-screen TVs along the south wall. I believe it has both Comcast cable, and DirecTV. If Tiffany is working, expect one of those TVs to be tuned to a Saint Louis team's game. Since I knew I was going on to the Map Room, I slummed here. Two-dollar 12-oz. cans of Schlitz are not my forté, but this lets me expound on whether a good beer drinker can _really_ taste the difference between the supposedly "no-budget" canned Schlitz, and the alleged "1960s formula", double-the-price, bottled Schlitz. I await Olympia and Falstaff to be re-dusted-off and sent back into the market with a higher price, just for those fans of 'retro' beers. This is not to infer that you can't get a quality beer here. Expect that its price may be average or above average, but not by so much that it triggers my "profiteering" flag. I would summarize by scribing that, as you would not usually order an italian beef sandwich from a hot dog stand, if you want a craft-brewed beer at a solid price in this neighborhood, you perhaps should not order it here. But maybe this venue will stock some beers that the venue over on Hoyne will not. I shall be giving Floyd's more chances. Transit options: View my review of Sam's Red Hots, which is one block west of here.

Best steak nachos I have ever had! Period. Cool atmosphere. Very sweet, attentive server (don't know her name). And they had the Sox game on in a land full of Cubs lovers. Overall, great first experience. I will be back. You had me at steak nachos...mmm.

Riding down Armitage, I ripped my favorite pants on the hardware that holds the lock to my bike. I came to a stop in front of Floyd's where Kelly the bartender was having a smoke.  I started talking to her about what happened and she offered to buy me a drink to ease my woes. I was sold from that moment on. She introduced me to the Kings of Leon, fed me the nights special, a full meatloaf dinner, and proceeded to get me all kinds of intoxicated. Go to Floyd's, enjoy yourself, and make sure you tip Kelly well when you see her.

Seriously one of the best grilled cheese sandwiches I've had in a while. Not only was it a triple decker, but when you add bacon and tomato its that much better. Their fries were good too, although the tater tots didn't look so hot. The music was perfect on the night in question as well. I didn't see anyone feeding the jukebox, but the shuffle they had going on was pretty sweet...

Well I would have loved to have started my review complimenting their Cuban sandwich but much to my dismay it was recently removed from their menu.  :(   The rest of the food is still better than average pub fare.   Major downside to trying to meet a group here for a bite to eat at night is that limited table space sometimes means everybody will show up and have to go elsewhere as there's not always enough room to accommodate all the guests. ===Update=== While there is still no cuban per say you can order something darn close :)  On another note the friendliness of the staff and their on the ball attitude has made me lift this up to a five star rating.  It's really not fair to complain about limited space but this is still a problem if your gathering in larger groups.

Upon recommendation of a friend of a friend, I went to Floyd's for dinner. He swore that it had the best grilled cheese ever. I ordered a turkey burger, which was good save for the fact that they consider American cheese to be cheddar. My friend got a steak sandwich which, to me, looked like a steak between bread. She only ate half; this is neither here nor there (we were accompanied by her friend/love interest so she might have been eating less because she was nervous?). The friend-of-a-friend got the triple-decker grilled cheese.  The beer selection is decent; they serve Three Floyd's, Dogfish, Rogue Brewery, etc.  Why only three stars? This place is way too expensive! our bill came to over $70 dollars. This is for PUB FARE and a few beers! Floyd's doesn't know what it wants to be--it's overpriced, serves strictly bar food, and has a somewhat vacant interior punctuated by flat-screen television sets. Oh, wait, I think I just figured out the genre Floyd's is going for:  Armitage before the economic collapse. And the grilled cheese sandwich? Let's put it this way: we found out at dinner that the friend-of-a-friend is into fat chicks.

I've been blessed to have had a lot of neighborhood bars, and this one unfortunately doesn't make my list.  It's just okay.  It's always a little cold (I usually just keep my coat on) and the food's really par.  If I want food, I'd much rather hit up Cleo's (just east of there on Armitage) or Logan's (just west of there at 2200ish N California) because they both have much better food.  They do have a cool atmosphere during summer games as they have them on and they open all of their windows, which is great.  Want a bar to have a drink and watch the game during the summer? It'll work.  Want a place to eat and chill?  Try elsewhere.

A nice pub, but not extraordinary.  Decent beer, but I will probably always amble down the extra 2 blocks to my favorite bar to get a broader selection. One key difference between Floyd's and said Favorite Bar are that Floyd's offers food.  I haven't tried any of the food yet, but it's good to have an option in the neighborhood for when I want both beer and bar food.
Alright little corner bar. Nice staff, decent food, and alright beer selection. That's all I got.

Floyds is the great corner hangout in your hood that packs an extra punch. The food is the extra punch I'm referring to! I've eaten there well over a dozen times since moving to Bucktown and I have not been dissapointed yet. Fresh, tasty, and clearly planned out is how I would describe the food and menu. I highly recommend checking it out. By the way I chose to give a 4 star rating instead of star's because then readers like yourself wouldn't expect perfection, and lets face it, everyone has a bad day so I'm just keeping it real. Your welcome Floyds staff.

It's a nice little pub.  The food is good, but nothing extraordinary.  Come here for the cheap drink or dinner specials, which are a good deal, or if you're in the neighborhood.   Loud music, conversation was a little strained. But if you're going to make a trip for a good burger, there's better to be had. ...although the serving of totally tasty tater tots (enough to choke a mule!) was very generous!

This place has good cheeseburgers and meatloaf on special during the week.  The staff is only ok.  They are a little prone to ignoring the patron.  All in all though, it's good food coupled with a fine beer selection.  It's never too annoyingly loud and the have a tone of tellies for cubs games.

i went to Floyd's on a Sunday night for some food and drinks with a friend. A tab of about $30 for chicken fingers, a triple-grilled cheese (with cream cheese and delicious fries), 3 beers and one bloody mary. Although we stuck with the $2 PBRs, there is a fair beer list and a pretty good food menu with slightly different options than I had expected (see triple grilled cheese). Plenty of TVs for sports watching and a spacious bar made me think I'd probably be back, especially since it's within walking distance of my apartment. The food we got wasn't overly impressive, but it didn't disappoint. Good service and friendly patrons.
